instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00138: What is 820-00138? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_LRESET_L: What is SMC_LRESET_L? SMC_LRESET_L is a typo of SMC_RESET_L. .
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Fan Spins, Green Light, No Sign Of Booting / No Display
threads.message:
Hello,

I have a MacBook that does not want to boot.
- We get a green light on the charger, fan spin, but no chime or display.
- External USB portable drive doesn't show any activity, seems brain dead.
- No signs of liquid damage.
- Tried clean ME region. 

<SIGNAL>PPBCC_S0_CPU_PH1</SIGNAL> / 2 / 3 = 1.7 volts

Any advice on how I should proceed with this? Thanks!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Fan Spins, Green Light, No Sign Of Booting / No Display
threads.message:
Any history available?
Tried new BIOS, or just cleaned ME on original?

Pins 2 & 4 of <CHIP>U2080</CHIP> come high?
Check <SIGNAL>SMC_LRESET_L</SIGNAL> too.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Fan Spins, Green Light, No Sign Of Booting / No Display
threads.message:
Customer turned it off one day and it never booted again.

I cleaned the ME region on the original. Pins 2 & 4 of <CHIP>U2080</CHIP> = 3.3 volts. <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> = 3.3 volts. What I noticed is that high fan spin and as soon as I measure <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL>, motherboard does a power cycle.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Fan Spins, Green Light, No Sign Of Booting / No Display
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Fan Spins, Green Light, No Sign Of Booting / No Display
threads.message: Thank you, it fixed it. After trying to write to the original BIOS chip another time, the chip failed completely. Unable to read or write to it. Got another one from a donor, flashed it with known good dump online and it now works.
